data.description: .Astera Labs (NASDAQ: ALAB) provides rack-scale AI infrastructure through purpose-built connectivity solutions. By collaborating with hyperscalers and ecosystem partners, Astera Labs enables organizations to unlock the full potential of modern AI. Astera Labs’ Intelligent Connectivity Platform integrates CXL®, Ethernet, NVLink, PCIe®, and UALink™ semiconductor-based technologies with the company’s COSMOS software suite to unify diverse components into cohesive, flexible systems that deliver end-to-end scale-up, and scale-out connectivity. The company’s custom connectivity solutions business complements its standards-based portfolio, enabling customers to deploy tailored architectures to meet their unique infrastructure requirements. Discover more at www.asteralabs.com.Product & Ecosystem Internship As a leader in semiconductor-based connectivity solutions for cloud and AI infrastructure, the Astera Labs Platform & Ecosystem team is responsible for keeping up with AI industry trends to provide guidance for product strategy and identify areas where we can help develop the ecosystem to accelerate product adoption. To support the mission, we build deep industry partnerships and strive to provide thought leadership for PCIe, CXL, and Ethernet solutions with data driven insights from market research, hardware validation, and test data gathered from key hardware and software components used in AI and cloud infrastructure. As an Astera Labs Product & Ecosystem Intern, you will work closely with Product Line Managers, Product and Field Application teams, engineering teams, and ecosystem partners to learn how connectivity solutions impact AI, web & database services. This is a highly analytical and technical role where time to insights is critical for driving conversations with customers, partners and industry defining organizations, such as OCP, PCI-SIG, and CXL Consortium. This entry-level role allows business-minded engineers to accelerate their career in AI infrastructure through interactions with industry veterans, and hands-on experience with real hardware supporting AI use cases. Responsibilities Understand the performance of leading-edge hardware and software technologies to develop value propositions of Astera Labs’ products Assist with COSMOS SW product development and testing Setup lab infrastructure, servers, storage & memory systems, and software to measure and monitor performance bottlenecks for specific datacenter use cases Work independently, demonstrating good judgment in performance engineering tasks, and contribute to the creative brainstorming of new ideas Root cause performance and scalability issues, and provide recommendations to solve them Analyze & present performance data and propose exploratory tests for deeper analysis Assist in exploring new use cases to substantiate industry trends and support outbound product marketing Develop presentations of proposals, results, and conclusions Basic Qualifications Basic understanding for PCIe, CXL, or Ethernet connectivity solutions used in cloud and AI infrastructure Ability to root cause performance bottlenecks with performance and monitoring tools Solid understanding of server CPU, memory, network, and storage hardware as they relate to performance Strong understanding of OS fundamentals (Linux) Good understanding of benchmark creation, measurement and modeling of system behavior under load Strong programming and scripting skills, including languages such as C/C++ and Python Good understanding and experience handling lab equipment such as Oscilloscope, logic analyzers, power supplies We know that creativity and innovation happen more often when teams include diverse ideas, backgrounds, and experiences, and we actively encourage everyone with relevant experience to apply, including people of color, LGBTQ+ and non-binary people, veterans, parents, and individuals with disabilities.
